publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3135 Donald Gorrie: Volunteers Week 2002-That the Parliament welcomes the efforts of Volunteer Development Scotland to encourage people to be volunteers during this year's Volunteers Week from 7 to 13 June 2002; congratulates and welcomes those who will be volunteering for the first time during that week; appreciates that very many of those volunteering will already be regular and committed volunteers who support individuals and communities in many indispensable ways, and commends the valuable contribution to Scottish life and communities made by volunteers from all walks of society.
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Michael Matheson*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Mr Mike Rumbles*, Robert Brown*

S1M-3135 Donald Gorrie: Volunteers Week 2002—That the Parliament welcomes the efforts of Volunteer Development Scotland to encourage people to be volunteers during this year’s Volunteers Week from 7 to 13 June 2002; congratulates and welcomes those who will be volunteering for the first time during that week; appreciates that very many of those volunteering will already be regular and committed volunteers who support individuals and communities in many indispensable ways, and commends the valuable contribution to Scottish life and communities made by volunteers from all walks of society. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Mike Rumbles, Robert Brown
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Iain Smith*, Shona Robison*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Fergus Ewing*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Michael Russell*, Alex Neil*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Cathie Craigie*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3135 Volunteers Week 2002 (lodged on 20 May 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*, Brian Adam*
